<A NAME="eolPage130"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	AMENDMENT NO. 2 TO
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	PROJECT ADDENDUM NO. 1 TO
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	MASTER SERVICES AND LICENSE AGREEMENT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Amendment No.&nbsp;2 to Project Addendum No.&nbsp;1 ( &#147;
<U>
	Amendment No.&nbsp;2
</U>
	&#148;), effective April&nbsp;30, 2010 (the
	&#147;
<U>
	Amendment No.&nbsp;2 Effective Date
</U>
	&#148;), is made and entered into by and between MDNH, Inc., a Delaware corporation with its principal place of business at 4425 Spring Mountain Road, Suite 210, Las Vegas, NV 89102 (&#147;
<U>
	Marchex
	Local
</U>
	&#148;), and YellowPages.com LLC d/b/a AT&amp;T Interactive, a Delaware limited liability company, with its principal place of business at 611 N. Brand Boulevard, 5
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	Floor, Glendale, CA
	91203 (&#147;
<U>
	ATTi
</U>
	&#148; or &#147;
<U>
	YPC
</U>
	&#148;), to amend and supplement: (i)&nbsp;that certain Project Addendum No.&nbsp;1 entered into between Marchex Local and ATTi effective as of January&nbsp;1, 2009 (&#147;
<U>
	Project Addendum
	No.&nbsp;1
</U>
	&#148;), as amended by Amendment No.&nbsp;1 to Project Addendum No.&nbsp;1 entered between Marchex Local and ATTi effective as of May&nbsp;13, 2009 (&#147;
<U>
	Amendment No.&nbsp;1
</U>
	&#148; and, together with Project Addendum No.1, the
	&#147;
<U>
	Project Addendum
</U>
	&#148;); (ii)&nbsp;Amendment No.&nbsp;1; and (iii)&nbsp;CRS1 (as defined below). The Project Addendum amended that certain Master Services and License Agreement entered into between Marchex Local and ATTi effective
	October&nbsp;1, 2007 (as amended by Change Rule Sheet No.&nbsp;1 (&#147;
<U>
	CRS1
</U>
	&#148;), Change Rule Sheet No.&nbsp;2 (&#147;
<U>
	CRS2
</U>
	&#148;), and Amendment No.&nbsp;1 to the Master Services and License Agreement (&#147;
<U>
	Master Amendment
	No.&nbsp;1
</U>
	&#148;) entered into between Marchex Local and ATTi, effective July&nbsp;16, 2009,&nbsp;October&nbsp;30, 2009, and April&nbsp;30, 2010, respectively (collectively, the &#147;
<U>
	Agreement
</U>
	&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Amendment No.&nbsp;2 is subject to and is governed by the terms of the Agreement and the Project Addendum; provided, however, that the
	provisions of this Amendment No.&nbsp;2 shall govern, control, and supersede any contrary or conflicting term or provision in the Agreement or in the Project Addendum. Any capitalized terms used herein but not defined shall have the meaning ascribed
	to them in the Agreement or the Project Addendum, as applicable.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Parties desire to amend the Project Addendum to:
	(i)&nbsp;provide for certain additional Advertiser contract options relating to the Budget Packages under the Project Addendum; (ii)&nbsp;revise certain terms relating to Call Tracking Numbers; (iii)&nbsp;modify certain fees and pricing;
	(iv)&nbsp;modify applicable Business Rules; and (v)&nbsp;modify the PA Term;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	NOW THEREFORE, for good and valuable consideration, the
	receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, as of the Amendment No.&nbsp;2 Effective Date, the Parties agree as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.
<U>
	Six-Month
	Budget Packages
</U>
	. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in Section I.e of Project Addendum No.&nbsp;1, and subject to the terms and conditions of this Amendment No.&nbsp;2, ATTi may offer Advertiser Terms relating to the Budget Packages that
	either provide for a minimum Advertiser campaign term of six (6)&nbsp;months or permit the Advertiser, at its option, to terminate the Budget Package contract after the first six (6)&nbsp;months of the campaign term (&#147;
<U>
	Six-Month
	Packages
</U>
	&#148;). With respect to each Six-Month Package sold to an Advertiser, ATTi will pay to Marchex Local a one-time fee of *** (&#147;
<U>
	Set-Up Fee
</U>
	&#148;) in addition to the other applicable fees described in the Project Addendum, ***.
	With respect to all Six-Month Packages hereunder, ATTi will pay Marchex Local the applicable Fees described in Section I.i of Project Addendum No.&nbsp;1. &#147;
<U>
	Aggregate Six-Month Spend
</U>
	&#148; means the aggregate amount of fees that an
	Advertiser has paid to ATTi for Budget Packages (including, without limitation Six-Month Packages) during the six (6)&nbsp;month period immediately preceding the effective date of the relevant Six-Month Package. For the avoidance of doubt, for the
	purposes of the preceding sentence, the &#147;Advertiser&#148; will include all multiple affiliated Advertisers, such as a parent entity (e.g., ***) and all dealers, franchisees, agents, and similar entities purchasing Budget Packages under the
	branding of the parent entity (e.g., *** agents).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	[***] Certain information in this
	agreement has been omitted and filed separately with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Confidential treatment has been granted with respect to the omitted portions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	16
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage131"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2.
<U>
	MALP Accounts for Six-Month Packages
</U>
	. For the avoidance of doubt: (a)&nbsp;Marchex Local may, upon the
	prior written approval of ATTi (email sufficient), offer MALP accounts in connection with the Six-Month Package accounts of multiple affiliated Advertisers, as further provided in Amendment No.&nbsp;1; and (b)&nbsp;the Set-Up Fee will apply in such
	event, subject to the waivers and exceptions set forth in Section&nbsp;1 of this Amendment No.&nbsp;2.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.
<U>
	Supplemental Business Rules
</U>
	. The parties
	desire to amend and restate the supplemental Business Rules applicable to the Budget Packages (including Six-Month Packages) in their entirety. The parties hereby agree that the supplemental Business Rules set forth in Section II of Project Addendum
	No.&nbsp;1 shall be and hereby are deleted in their entirety and replaced with the supplemental Business Rules set forth in Attachment 1 to this Amendment No.&nbsp;2. The terms of Attachment 1 hereto shall be added at the end of Exhibit A to the
	Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4.
<U>
	Enabling Messaging Functionality
</U>
	. Section I.c of Project Addendum No.&nbsp;1 shall be and hereby is deleted in its entirety and
	replaced with the following language:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#147;
<U>
	Call Tracking Numbers
</U>
	. Unless otherwise specified by YPC, Marchex Local shall obtain
	and supply a Call Tracking Number for each Advertiser for which a Call Tracking Number is requested. If YPC obtains Call Tracking Numbers through Marchex Local; ***. For the avoidance of doubt, as between the parties, YPC will not be the subscriber
	of the relevant Call Tracking Number telecommunications provider or have privity of contract with such provider, and nothing herein shall be construed to suggest that YPC is providing telecommunication services. All Call Tracking Numbers shall
	otherwise materially conform to the Business Rules. These Call Tracking Numbers are delivered pursuant to confidential third party agreements with carriers, and in certain cases such numbers may be subject to cancellation or changes based on
	applicable law or regulation or change in carrier status of the third party carrier or vendor, as applicable (&#147;Industry Changes&#148;). Marchex Local will use commercially reasonable efforts to avoid or minimize the impact of Industry Changes;
	however, except as expressly provided herein, Marchex Local makes no representations, warranties or guarantees of any kind in connection with the Call Tracking Numbers. The messaging functionality will be enabled in connection with Call Tracking
	Numbers and the following message shall be played to Advertisers when the Advertiser picks up a call but before the Advertiser is connected to the caller: &#147;Leads brought to you by AT&amp;T Interactive.&#148; ***
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	5.
<U>
	Additional Call Tracking Numbers for Save Program and Enhanced Program
</U>
	. The parties desire to amend the Business Rules applicable to the Save
	Program and the Enhanced Program established under CRS1. In lieu of mutually executing an additional Change Rule Sheet, the parties hereby agree that, at the request of ATTi, Marchex Local shall provide and implement, under the terms of the Save
	Program or the Enhanced Program, more than one Call Tracking Number for particular Advertisers specified by ATTi. *** For the avoidance of any doubt: (a)&nbsp;the foregoing change to the Business Rules hereby expressly supersedes the terms of
	subsection (iii)&nbsp;of the third paragraph of the
<U>
	Additional Notes: Pricing
</U>
	section of CRS1; and (b)&nbsp;the only business unit to which such change applies is ATTi.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	[***] Certain information in this
	agreement has been omitted and filed separately with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Confidential treatment has been granted with respect to the omitted portions.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	17

	The foregoing states the total fees and charges payable to Marchex Local with respect to
	the Budget Packages.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	7.
<U>
	PA Term Renewal
</U>
	. Section I.h of the Project Addendum shall be and hereby is deleted in its entirety and replaced with the
	following language:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; MARGIN-LEFT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<U>
	&#147;Term
</U>
	. This Project Addendum shall be effective on the Addendum Effective Date and continue in effect
	until the termination or expiration of the Agreement (the &#147;PA Term&#148;). After the end of the PA Term, upon mutual agreement of the Parties, Marchex Local shall continue to provide all Services for any and all Budget Packages (including
	Six-Month Packages) issued by YPC prior to the end of the PA Term until the expiration or termination of the Advertiser Terms related to such Budget Packages, but in no event later than twelve (12)&nbsp;months following the end of the PA Term. The
	preceding sentence along with other Sections hereof, including portions of Exhibit A, as amended herein, that should reasonably survive termination, shall survive any expiration or termination of this Project Addendum for any reason.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

	. Other than the specific terms and conditions expressly referenced above, this Amendment
	No.&nbsp;2 shall not be construed to modify any term or condition of the Agreement or the Project Addendum, which will all otherwise remain unchanged and in full force and effect. This Amendment No.&nbsp;2 may be executed in several counterparts,
	each of which will be deemed to be an original, and all of which, when taken together, shall constitute one and the same instrument. A signature received via facsimile or via email shall be as legally binding for all purposes as an original
	signature.

<U>
	Agreement
</U>
	&#148;), and the Amended and
	Restated 2003 Stock Incentive Plan, as amended to date (the &#147;

	, respectively, which may be found at http://intranet.marchex.com, you have been granted an option (the
	&#147;
<U>
	Option
</U>
	&#148;) to purchase the number of shares set forth below (the &#147;
<U>

</U>
	&#148;) of Class B Common Stock, $.01 par value per share (the &#147;

<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="13">
	Until otherwise terminated under the Plan or the Agreement and assuming the Optionee is employed by the Company or continues to work as a consultant for the Company on the applicable vesting date, one hundred percent
	(100%) of the aggregate amount of the Shares underlying this Option shall vest on the later of (a) the 12 (tranche a), 21 (tranche b) or 30 (tranche c) month anniversary of the Grant Date, and (b) the last day of the first 20 consecutive trading day
	period after the Grant Date during which the average closing price of the Company&#146;s Shares over such period is equal to or greater than $7.00 (tranche a), $8.00 (tranche b) or $9.00 (tranche c). Notwithstanding the foregoing, one hundred
	percent (100%) of the Shares underlying this Option not already vested as of the date thereof, shall become immediately vested upon the occurrence of both (a) a Change of Control, (b) followed by (i) a termination without cause of the
	Optionee&#146;s employment by the Company or any successor thereto, (ii) a Diminution in Duties with respect to the Optionee, or (iii) the 12 (tranche a), 21 (tranche b) or 30 (tranche c) month anniversary of the occurrence of the Change of
	Control.

<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="6">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="5">
	a complete liquidation or dissolution of the Company; or
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="5">

</TD>

<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="14">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="13">
	Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Change of Control shall not be deemed to occur solely because any Person (the &#147;
<U>
	Subject Person
</U>
	&#148;) acquired Beneficial Ownership of more than the permitted amount of the
	outstanding Voting Securities as a result of the acquisition of Voting Securities by the Company which, by reducing the number of Voting Securities outstanding, increases the proportional number of shares Beneficially Owned by the Subject Person,
	provided that if a Change of Control would occur (but for the operation of this sentence) and after such acquisition of Voting Securities by the Company, the Subject Person becomes the Beneficial Owner of any additional Voting Securities, then a
	Change of Control shall occur.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="14">
</TD>
</TR>

</TD>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="13">
	For the purposes hereof, &#147;
<U>
	Diminution in Duties
</U>
	&#148; shall mean the occurrence of any of the following events without the Optionee&#146;s express written consent;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

	immediately prior to the Change of Control;
</TD>
</TR>

<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Attorney&#146;s Fees:
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="13">
	In the event that any suit or action is instituted to enforce any provision in this Agreement, the prevailing party in such dispute shall be entitled to recover from the losing party all fees, costs and expenses of
	enforcing any right of such prevailing party under or with respect to this Agreement, including without limitation, such reasonable fees and expenses of attorneys and accountants, which shall include, without limitation, all fees, costs and expenses
	of appeals. Except as otherwise permitted by Section&nbsp;409A of the Code, any reimbursement to which Optionee is entitled pursuant to this paragraph shall (a)&nbsp;be paid no later than the last day of Optionee&#146;s taxable year following the
	taxable year in which the expense was incurred, (b)&nbsp;not be affected by the amount of expenses eligible for reimbursement in any other taxable year, and (c)&nbsp;not be subject to liquidation or exchange for another benefit.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">

	Compliance with Section&nbsp;409A:
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="13">
	The Company intends that income provided to Optionee pursuant to this Agreement will not be subject to taxation under Section&nbsp;409A of the Code. The provisions of this Agreement shall be interpreted and construed in
	favor of satisfying any applicable requirements of Section&nbsp;409A. However, the Company does not guarantee any particular tax effect for income provided to Optionee pursuant to this Agreement. In any event, except for the responsibility of the
	Company to withhold applicable income and employment taxes from compensation paid or provided to Optionee, the Company shall not be responsible for the payment of any applicable taxes incurred by Optionee on compensation paid or provided to Optionee
	pursuant to this Agreement.
</TD>
</TR>

<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="13">

	understanding and agreement of the Optionee and the Company or an Affiliate with respect to the subject matter contained herein or therein and supersede any prior agreements, understandings, restrictions, representations, or warranties among the
	Optionee and the Company and its Affiliate with respect to such subject matter other than those as set forth or provided for herein or therein. To the extent contemplated herein or therein, the provisions of this Grant Notice, the Agreement and the
	Plan shall survive any exercise of the Option and shall remain in full force and effect.
</TD>

<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage142"></A>
<A NAME="D40517DEX1020_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10_3"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.20
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	FORM OF NOTICE OF GRANT OF EXECUTIVE OFFICER STOCK OPTION
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	(TIME-BASED)
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To:
<U>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</U>
	(the &#147;
<U>
	Optionee
</U>
	&#148;)
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As per the general terms and conditions set forth on this Stock Option Agreement (the &#147;
<U>
	Agreement
</U>
	&#148;), and the Amended and
	Restated 2003 Stock Incentive Plan, as amended to date (the &#147;
<U>
	Plan
</U>
	&#148;),
<U>
	Exhibit A
</U>
	and
<U>
	Exhibit B
</U>
	, respectively, which may be found at http://intranet.marchex.com, you have been granted an option (the
	&#147;
<U>
	Option
</U>
	&#148;) to purchase the number of shares set forth below (the &#147;
<U>
	Shares
</U>
	&#148;) of Class B Common Stock, $.01 par value per share (the &#147;
<U>
	Common Stock
</U>
	&#148;) of Marchex, Inc. (the &#147;
<U>
	Company
</U>
	&#148;),
	for the aggregate Purchase Price set forth below (the &#147;
<U>
	Purchase Price
</U>

	for the following three years in equal increments and according to such other conditions as are set forth in the Agreement and the Plan.

</U>

	outstanding Voting Securities as a result of the acquisition of Voting Securities by the Company which, by reducing the number of Voting Securities outstanding, increases the proportional number of shares Beneficially Owned by the Subject Person,
	provided that if a Change of Control would occur (but for the operation of this sentence) and after such acquisition of Voting Securities by the Company, the Subject Person becomes the Beneficial Owner of any additional Voting Securities, then a
	Change of Control shall occur.

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="7">
	a material diminution in the nature or scope of the Optionee&#146;s duties, responsibilities, authority, powers or functions as compared to the Optionee&#146;s duties, responsibilities, authority, powers or functions
	immediately prior to the Change of Control;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="2">

	if the Optionee is no longer (a)&nbsp;an executive officer of a publicly-traded company, or (b)&nbsp;a Section&nbsp;16 reporting person under the 1934 Act;
</TD>
</TR>

	the relocation of Optionee&#146;s office at which he is to perform his duties and responsibilities hereunder to a location more than sixty (60) miles from Seattle, Washington.
</TD>

<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="13">
	There shall be no proportionate or partial vesting in the periods prior to the applicable vesting dates and all vesting shall occur only on the appropriate vesting date. The Compensation Committee may, in its sole
	discretion, provide for accelerated vesting of the Shares underlying this Option at any time.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="14">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Attorney&#146;s Fees:
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="13">
	In the event that any suit or action is instituted to enforce any provision in this Agreement, the prevailing party in such dispute shall be entitled to recover from the losing party all fees, costs and expenses of
	enforcing any right of such prevailing party under or with respect to this Agreement, including without limitation, such reasonable fees and expenses of attorneys and accountants, which shall include, without limitation, all fees, costs and expenses
	of appeals. Except as otherwise permitted by Section&nbsp;409A of the Code, any reimbursement to which Optionee is entitled pursuant to this paragraph shall (a)&nbsp;be paid no later than the last day of Optionee&#146;s taxable year following the
	taxable year in which the expense was incurred, (b)&nbsp;not be affected by the amount of expenses eligible for reimbursement in any other taxable year, and (c)&nbsp;not be subject to liquidation or exchange for another benefit.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="14">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
	Compliance with Section&nbsp;409A:
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="13">
	The Company intends that income provided to Optionee pursuant to this Agreement will not be subject to taxation under Section&nbsp;409A of the Code. The provisions of this Agreement shall be interpreted and construed in
	favor of satisfying any applicable requirements of Section&nbsp;409A. However, the Company does not guarantee any particular tax effect for income provided to Optionee pursuant to this Agreement. In any event, except for the responsibility of the
	Company to withhold applicable income and employment taxes from compensation paid or provided to Optionee, the Company shall not be responsible for the payment of any applicable taxes incurred by Optionee on compensation paid or provided to Optionee
	pursuant to this Agreement.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="14">
</TD>
</TR>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="13">
	This Grant Notice, the Agreement and the Plan, together with any employment, service or other agreement between the Optionee and the Company or an Affiliate applicable to the award, shall constitute the entire
	understanding and agreement of the Optionee and the Company or an Affiliate with respect to the subject matter contained herein or therein and supersede any prior agreements, understandings, restrictions, representations, or warranties among the
	Optionee and the Company and its Affiliate with respect to such subject matter other than those as set forth or provided for herein or therein. To the extent contemplated herein or therein, the provisions of this Grant Notice, the Agreement and the
	Plan shall survive any exercise of the Option and shall remain in full force and effect.
</TD>
</TR>

<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10_4"></A>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_51"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.21
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	FORM OF NOTICE OF GRANT OF EXECUTIVE OFFICER RESTRICTED STOCK UNITS
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Participant has been granted an award of Restricted Stock Units (the
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
<B>
<I>
	Award
</I>
</B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
	) pursuant to the Marchex, Inc. 2003
	Amended and Restated Stock Incentive Plan, as amended to date (the
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
<B>
<I>
	Plan
</I>
</B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
	), each of which represents the right to receive on the applicable Settlement Date one (1)&nbsp;Share common stock of Marchex, Inc. (the
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
<B>
<I>
	Company
</I>
</B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
	), as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="22%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="62%">
</TD>

<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">

</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;

	For each Restricted Stock Unit, except as otherwise provided by the Restricted Stock Units Agreement, the date on which such unit becomes a Vested Unit in accordance with the vesting schedule set forth below.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="8">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Vested Units:
</B>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="7">
	Except as provided by the Restricted Stock Units Agreement and provided that the Participant&#146;s service has not terminated prior to the relevant date, the Restricted Stock Units will be deemed to become Vested Units
	as follows:
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="8">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">
<TD VALIGN="TOP">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="7">
	One hundred percent (100%) of the aggregate amount of the Restricted Stock Units shall vest on the later of (a) the 12 (tranche a), 21 (tranche b) or 30 (tranche c) month anniversary of the Grant Date, and (b) the last
	day of the first 20 consecutive trading day period after the Grant Date during which the average closing price of the Company&#146;s Shares over such period is equal to or greater than $7.00 (tranche a), $8.00 (tranche b) or $9.00 (tranche c).
	Notwithstanding the foregoing, one hundred percent (100%) of the Restricted Stock Units not already vested as of the date thereof, shall become immediately vested upon the occurrence of both (a) a Change of Control, (b) followed by (i) a termination
	without cause of the Participant&#146;s employment by the Company or any successor thereto, (ii) a Diminution in Duties with respect to the Participant, or (iii) the 12 (tranche a), 21 (tranche b) or 30 (tranche c) month anniversary of the
	occurrence of the Change of Control.
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">
<TD HEIGHT="8">
</TD>
<TD HEIGHT="8" COLSPAN="8">
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT">

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" COLSPAN="7">
	For the purposes hereof, &#147;
<U>
	Change of Control
</U>
	&#148; shall mean the occurrence of any of the following events, provided that the per-share value of the Company&#146;s Shares in such Change of Control transaction
	(except for subparagraph (ii) below) is equal to or greater than $7.00 (tranche a), $8.00 (tranche b) or $9.00 (tranche c):
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT">

</TD>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;

<U>

</U>

<U>

</U>

	used for the purposes of Section 13(d) or 14(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;
<U>

</U>
	&#148;)) immediately after which such Person or Group has Beneficial Ownership (within the meaning of Rule l3d-3
	promulgated under the Exchange Act) of fifty percent (50%) or more of the combined voting power of the Company&#146;s then-outstanding Voting Securities; provided, however, in determining whether or not a Change of Control has occurred, Voting
	Securities which are acquired in a &#147;
<U>
	Non-Control Acquisition
</U>
	&#148; (as hereinafter defined) shall not constitute an acquisition which would constitute a Change of Control. A &#147;
<U>
	Non-Control Acquisition
</U>
	&#148; shall mean an
	acquisition by (i) any employee benefit plan (or related trust) sponsored or maintained by
</TD>

	provided that if a Change of Control would occur (but for the operation of this sentence) and after such acquisition of Voting Securities by the Company, the Subject Person becomes the Beneficial Owner of any additional Voting Securities, then a
	Change of Control shall occur.

	By their signatures below or by electronic acceptance or authentication in a form authorized by the Company, the Company and
	the Participant agree that the Award is governed by this Notice and by the provisions of the Plan and the Restricted Stock Units Agreement, both of which are made a part of this document. The Participant acknowledges that copies of the Plan,
	Restricted Stock Units Agreement and the prospectus for the Plan are available on the Company&#146;s internal web site and may be viewed and printed by the Participant for attachment to the Participant&#146;s copy of this Grant Notice. The
	Participant represents that the Participant has read and is familiar with the provisions of the Plan and Restricted Stock Units Agreement, and hereby accepts the Award subject to all of their terms and conditions.
</P>

<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage153"></A>
<A NAME="D40517DEX1022_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_10>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_10_5"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<B>
	Exhibit 10.22
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<U>
	FORM OF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
<U>
	RESTRICTED STOCK AGREEMENT
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	This Restricted Stock Agreement (the &#147;
<U>
	Agreement
</U>
	&#148;) is entered into this
	11
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	day of May, 2010 between Marchex, Inc., a Delaware corporation (the &#147;
<U>
	Company
</U>
	&#148;) and
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; (the &#147;
<U>
	Participant
</U>
	&#148;).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:24PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	WITNESSETH:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the
	Compensation Committee of the Company has agreed to grant to the Participant, &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; shares of the Company&#146;s Class B common stock, par value $0.01 per
	share (the &#147;
<U>
	Shares
</U>
	&#148; or &#147;
<U>
	Common Stock
</U>
	&#148;) in accordance with the terms and conditions of the Company&#146;s 2003 Amended and Restated Stock Incentive Plan, as amended to date (the &#147;
<U>
	Plan
</U>
	&#148;); and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, the Shares are subject to certain restrictions; and
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	WHEREAS, a condition to the grant of the Shares to the Participant is that the Participant execute this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing, the mutual covenants contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the
	receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties hereby agree as follows:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.
<U>
	Grant of Shares.
</U>
	Subject to the
	terms, conditions and restrictions of the Plan and this Agreement, the Company hereby awards to the Participant, &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Shares on May&nbsp;11, 2010 (the
	&#147;
<U>
	Grant Date
</U>
	&#148;). To the extent required by law, the Participant shall pay the Company the par value ($0.01) (the &#147;
<U>
	Purchase Price
</U>
	&#148;) for each Share awarded to the Participant simultaneously with the execution of this
	Agreement in cash or cash equivalents payable to the order of the Company. Pursuant to the Plan and Section&nbsp;4 of this Agreement, the Shares are subject to certain restrictions, which restrictions shall expire in accordance with the provisions
	of the Plan and Section&nbsp;4 hereof. While such restrictions are in effect, the Shares subject to such restrictions shall be referred to herein as &#147;
<U>
	Restricted Stock
</U>
	&#148;, and Shares as to which such restrictions have expired shall be
	referred to herein as &#147;
<U>
	Vested Shares
</U>
	.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2.
<U>
	Right to Repurchase Upon Termination of Employment Relationship
</U>
	. In the
	event Participant&#146;s employment relationship with the Company terminates, for any reason whatsoever, whether due to voluntary or involuntary action, death, disability or otherwise, the Company shall have the right to repurchase at the original
	price paid therefor all or any portion of the Restricted Stock, which right may be exercised at any time and from time to time within ninety (90)&nbsp;days after the date of such termination.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.
<U>
	Exercise of Right of Repurchase
</U>
	. The Company may exercise its right of repurchase by providing written notice to the Participant
	stating the number of Shares of Restricted Stock to be repurchased, the aggregate price to be paid (the &#147;
<U>
	Repurchase Price
</U>
	&#148;) and the date (the &#147;
<U>
	Repurchase Date
</U>
	&#148;) such repurchase shall occur (which shall be a date not
	fewer than ten (10)&nbsp;and not more than thirty&nbsp;(30) days from the date of such notice). On the
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage154"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Repurchase Date, the Company shall deliver the Repurchase Price to the Participant, by check or wire of
	immediately available funds, against delivery of the certificate or certificates representing the Shares to be repurchased and duly endorsed stock powers.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4.
<U>
	Vesting of Shares
</U>
	. So long as the Participant continues to remain as an employee of the Company, the Shares will be deemed to become
	&#147;Vested Shares&#148; as follows: 25% of the total Shares shall vest on each of the first, second, third and fourth annual anniversaries, respectively, of the Grant Date such that the Shares shall be vested in full on the fourth anniversary of
	the Grant Date. One hundred percent (100%)&nbsp;of the Shares not already vested as of the date thereof, shall become immediately vested upon the occurrence of both (a)&nbsp;a Change of Control, (b)&nbsp;followed by (i)&nbsp;a termination without
	cause of the Participant&#146;s employment by the Company or any successor thereto, (ii)&nbsp;a Diminution in Duties with respect to the Participant, or (iii)&nbsp;the 12 month anniversary of the occurrence of the Change of Control.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For the purposes hereof, &#147;
<U>
	Change of Control
</U>
	&#148; shall mean the occurrence of any of the following events:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	an acquisition (other than directly from the Company) of any voting securities of the Company (the &#147;
<U>
	Voting Securities
</U>
	&#148;) by any &#147;
<U>
	Person
</U>
	&#148; or &#147;
<U>
	Group
</U>
	&#148; (as such terms are
	used for the purposes of Section&nbsp;13(d) or 14(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the &#147;
<U>
	Exchange Act
</U>
	&#148;)) immediately after which such Person or Group has Beneficial Ownership (within the meaning of Rule l3d-3
	promulgated under the Exchange Act) of fifty percent (50%)&nbsp;or more of the combined voting power of the Company&#146;s then-outstanding Voting Securities; provided, however, in determining whether or not a Change of Control has occurred, Voting
	Securities which are acquired in a &#147;
<U>
	Non-Control Acquisition
</U>
	&#148; (as hereinafter defined) shall not constitute an acquisition which would constitute a Change of Control. A &#147;
<U>
	Non-Control Acquisition
</U>
	&#148; shall mean an
	acquisition by (i)&nbsp;any employee benefit plan (or related trust) sponsored or maintained by the Company or any affiliate of the Company, (ii)&nbsp;the Company, (iii)&nbsp;any Person in connection with a Non-Control Transaction (as hereinafter
	defined), or (iv)&nbsp;any holder of the Company&#146;s Class&nbsp;A Common Stock as of the date hereof;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	individuals who, as of the date hereof, constitute the Board (the &#147;
<U>
	Incumbent Board
</U>
	&#148;) cease for any reason to constitute at least a majority of the Board; provided, however, that any individual becoming
	a director subsequent to the date hereof whose election, or nomination for election by the Company&#146;s shareholders, was approved by a vote of at least a majority of the directors then comprising the Incumbent Board shall be considered as though
	such individual were a member of the Incumbent Board, but excluding, for this purpose, any such individual whose initial assumption of office occurs as a result of an actual or threatened election contest with respect to the election or removal of
	directors or other actual or threatened solicitation of proxies or consents by or on behalf of a Person other than the Board; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	-2-
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage155"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the consummation of:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(a)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	A merger, consolidation or reorganization with or into the Company or in which securities of the Company are issued, unless such merger, consolidation or reorganization is a &#147;
<U>
	Non-Control Transaction
</U>
	&#148;. A
	&#147;
<U>
	Non-Control Transaction
</U>
	&#148; is a merger, consolidation or reorganization with or into the Company or in which securities of the Company are issued where:
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	A.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the shareholders, of the Company immediately before such merger, consolidation, or reorganization, own, directly or indirectly, at least fifty-one percent (51%)&nbsp;of the combined voting power of the outstanding
	voting securities of the corporation resulting form such merger, consolidation or reorganization (the &#147;
<U>
	Surviving Corporation
</U>
	&#148;) in substantially the same proportion as their ownership of the Voting Securities immediately before such
	merger, consolidation or reorganization,
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	B.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the individuals who were members of the Incumbent Board immediately prior to the execution of the agreement providing for such merger, consolidation or reorganization constitute at least a majority of the members of the
	board of directors of the Surviving Corporation or a corporation owning directly or indirectly fifty-one percent (51%)&nbsp;or more of the Voting Securities of the Surviving Corporation, and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="17%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	C.
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	no Person or Group, other than (i)&nbsp;the Company, (ii)&nbsp;any subsidiary of the Company, (iii)&nbsp;any employee benefit plan (or any trust forming a part thereof) maintained by the Company immediately prior to
	such merger, consolidation, or reorganization, or (iv)&nbsp;any holder of the Company&#146;s Class&nbsp;A Common Stock as of the date hereof, owns twenty percent (20%)&nbsp;or more of the combined voting power of the Surviving Corporation&#146;s
	then-outstanding voting securities; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(b)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	a complete liquidation or dissolution of the Company; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(c)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the sale of disposition of all or substantially all of the assets of the Company to any Person.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notwithstanding the foregoing, a Change of Control shall not be deemed to occur solely because any Person (the &#147;
<U>
	Subject
	Person
</U>
	&#148;) acquired Beneficial Ownership of more than the permitted amount of the outstanding Voting Securities as a result of the acquisition of Voting Securities by the Company which, by reducing the number of Voting Securities outstanding,
	increases the proportional number of shares Beneficially Owned by the Subject Person, provided
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	-3-
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage156"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	that if a Change of Control would occur (but for the operation of this sentence) and after such acquisition of
	Voting Securities by the Company, the Subject Person becomes the Beneficial Owner of any additional Voting Securities, then a Change of Control shall occur.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For the purposes hereof, &#147;
<U>
	Diminution in Duties
</U>
	&#148; shall mean the occurrence of any of the following events without the
	Participant&#146;s express written consent;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(i)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	a material diminution in the nature or scope of the Participant&#146;s duties, responsibilities, authority, powers or functions as compared to the Participant&#146;s duties, responsibilities, authority, powers or
	functions immediately prior to the Change of Control;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(ii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	if the Participant is no longer (a)&nbsp;an executive officer of a publicly-traded company, or (b)&nbsp;a Section&nbsp;16 reporting person under the 1934 Act;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iii)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	a reduction in the Participant&#146;s Annual Salary; or
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	(iv)
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the relocation of Participant&#146;s office at which he is to perform his duties and responsibilities hereunder to a location more than sixty (60)&nbsp;miles from Seattle, Washington.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	There shall be no proportionate or partial vesting in the periods prior to the applicable vesting dates and all vesting shall occur only on
	the appropriate vesting date. The Compensation Committee may, in its sole discretion, provide for accelerated vesting of the Shares at any time.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	5.
<U>
	Transfers
</U>
	. No Participant shall, directly or indirectly, sell, assign, transfer, pledge, hypothecate, mortgage, encumber or dispose
	of (either voluntarily or by operation of law or otherwise) all or any of his Restricted Stock (or any interest therein or any option, warrant or other right with respect thereto).
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	6.
<U>
	Rights as a Holder of Restricted Stock
</U>
	. From and after the Grant Date, the Participant shall have, with respect to the Restricted
	Stock, all of the rights of a holder of shares of Common Stock, including, without limitation, the right to receive and retain all regular cash dividends payable to holders of shares of record on and after the Grant Date (although such dividends
	will be treated, to the extent required by applicable law, as additional compensation for tax purposes), voting rights and to exercise all other rights, powers and privileges of a holder of shares with respect to the Restricted Stock, with the
	exceptions that (i)&nbsp;the Participant shall not be entitled to delivery of the stock certificate or certificates representing the Restricted Stock until such shares are no longer Restricted Stock; and (ii)&nbsp;the Company (or its designated
	agent) will retain custody of the stock certificate or certificates representing the Restricted Stock.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	7.
<U>
	Taxes; Section&nbsp;83(b)
	Election
</U>
	. The Participant acknowledges that (i)&nbsp;no later than the date on which any Restricted Stock shall have become vested or upon the filing of an election under Section&nbsp;83(b) as provided below, the Participant shall pay to the
	Company, or make arrangements satisfactory to the Company regarding payment of, any federal, state or local taxes of any kind required by law to be withheld with respect to any Restricted Stock which shall have become so vested; and (ii)&nbsp;the
	Company shall, to the extent permitted by law, have the right to
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	-4-
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage157"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	deduct from any payment of any kind otherwise due to the Participant any federal, state or local taxes of any
	kind required by law to be withheld with respect to any Restricted Stock which shall have become so vested or other withholding taxes that are required by law, including that the Company may, but shall not be required to, sell a number of Shares
	sufficient to cover applicable withholding taxes. Subject to the Participant&#146;s compliance with the Company&#146;s policy on Insider Trading (as in effect from time to time), the Participant may elect to pay the Company his or her obligations
	for the payment of such taxes through a special sale and remittance procedure commonly referred to as a
<I>
	&#147;cashless exercise&#148; or &#147;sell to cover&#148;
</I>
	transaction pursuant to which the Participant shall concurrently provide
	irrevocable written instructions: (i)&nbsp;to the Company&#146;s designated stock plan administrator to effect the immediate sale of a sufficient number of the Shares acquired upon the vesting of the Shares to enable the Company&#146;s designated
	stock plan administrator to remit, out of the sales proceeds available upon the settlement date, sufficient funds to the Company to cover all applicable federal, state and local income and employment taxes required to be withheld by the Company by
	reason of such vesting and/or sale; and (ii)&nbsp;to the Company to deliver any certificate(s) or other evidence of ownership for such sold Shares directly to the Company&#146;s designated stock plan administrator in order to complete the sale
	transaction. The Participant also acknowledges that it is his or her sole responsibility, and not the Company&#146;s, to file timely and properly any election under Section&nbsp;83(b) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the
	&#147;
<U>
	Code
</U>
	&#148;), and any corresponding provisions of state tax laws, if the Participant wishes to utilize such election.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	8.
<U>
	Legend
</U>
	. In the event that a certificate evidencing Restricted Stock is issued, the certificate representing the Shares shall have endorsed thereon the following legend:
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#147;THE ANTICIPATION, ALIENATION, ATTACHMENT, SALE, TRANSFER, ASSIGNMENT, PLEDGE, ENCUMBRANCE OR CHARGE OF THE SHARES OF STOCK REPRESENTED HEREBY ARE
	SUBJECT TO THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS (INCLUDING FORFEITURE) OF THE MARCHEX, INC. (THE &#147;
<U>
	COMPANY
</U>
	&#148;) 2003 AMENDED AND RESTATED STOCK INCENTIVE PLAN, AS AMENDED TO DATE (THE &#147;
<U>
	PLAN
</U>
	&#148;) AND AN AGREEMENT ENTERED INTO BETWEEN
	THE REGISTERED OWNER AND THE COMPANY DATED AS OF THE 11
<SUP STYLE="FONT-SIZE:85%; VERTICAL-ALIGN:TOP">
	th
</SUP>
	DAY OF MAY, 2010. COPIES OF SUCH PLAN AND AGREEMENT ARE ON FILE AT THE PRINCIPAL OFFICE OF THE COMPANY.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	9.
<U>
	Recapitalizations, Reorganizations, Changes in Control and the Like
</U>
	. Adjustments and certain other matters relating to
	recapitalizations, reorganizations, sale of the assets of the Company, changes in control and the like shall be made and determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;16 of the Plan, as in effect on the date of this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	10.
<U>
	Failure to Deliver Shares
</U>
	. If the Participant becomes obligated to sell any Shares to the Company under this Agreement and fails to
	deliver such Shares in accordance with the terms of this Agreement, the Company may, at its option, in addition to all other remedies it may have, send to the defaulting Participant the Purchase Price for such Shares as is herein specified.
	Thereupon, the Company, upon written notice to the defaulting Participant, shall cancel on its books the certificate or certificates representing the Shares to be sold, and all of the defaulting Participant&#146;s rights in and to such Shares shall
	terminate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	-5-
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage158"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	11.
<U>
	Specific Enforcement
</U>
	. The Participant expressly agrees that the Company may be
	irreparably damaged if this Agreement is not specifically enforced. Upon a breach or threatened breach of the terms, covenants and/or conditions of this Agreement by Participant, the Company shall, in addition to all other remedies, each be entitled
	to apply for a temporary or permanent injunction, and/or a decree for specific performance, in accordance with the provisions hereof.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	12.
<U>
	No Special Employment or Other Contract Rights
</U>
	. Nothing contained in this Agreement shall be construed or deemed by any person under any circumstances to bind the Company to continue the employment relationship of the Participant for the
	period within which the Shares shall vest.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	13.
<U>
	Attorneys-in-Fact
</U>
	. Each Participant hereby irrevocably appoints each person who may
	from time to time serve as Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer or General Counsel of the Company as his or her attorney-in-fact with specific authority to execute, acknowledge, swear to, file, and deliver all consents, elections,
	instruments, certificates, and other documents and to take any other action requisite to carrying out the intention and purpose of this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	14.
<U>
	Provisions of Plan Control
</U>
	. This Agreement is subject to all the terms, conditions and provisions of the Plan, including, without
	limitation, the amendment provisions thereof, and to such rules, regulations and interpretations relating to the Plan as may be adopted by the Compensation Committee and as may be in effect from time to time. The Plan is incorporated herein by
	reference. A copy of the Plan has been delivered to the Participant. If and to the extent that this Agreement conflicts or is inconsistent with the terms, conditions and provisions of the Plan, the Plan shall control, and this Agreement shall be
	deemed to be modified accordingly. Unless otherwise indicated, any capitalized term used but not defined herein shall have the meaning ascribed to such term in the Plan. This Agreement and the Plan, together with any employment, service or other
	agreement between the Participant and the Company or an Affiliate applicable to the award, shall constitute the entire understanding and agreement of the Participant and the Company or an Affiliate with respect to the subject matter contained herein
	or therein and supersede any prior agreements, understandings, restrictions, representations, or warranties among the Participant and the Company and its Affiliate with respect to such subject matter other than those as set forth or provided for
	herein or therein.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	15.
<U>
	Governing Law; Successors and Assigns
</U>
	. This Agreement shall be governed by the internal and substantive
	laws of the State of Delaware without giving effect to the conflicts of laws principles thereof and, except as otherwise provided herein, shall be binding upon the heirs, personal representatives, executors, administrators, successors and assigns of
	the parties. Each party hereby consents to the personal jurisdiction of the State of Delaware, acknowledges that venue is proper in any state or Federal court in the State of Delaware, agrees that any action related to this Agreement must be brought
	in a state or Federal court in the State of Delaware and waives any objection that may exist, now or in the future, with respect to any of the foregoing.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	16.
<U>
	Attorney&#146;s Fees
</U>
	. In the event that any suit or action is instituted to enforce any provision in this Agreement, the prevailing
	party in such dispute shall be entitled to recover from the losing party all fees, costs and expenses of enforcing any right of such prevailing party under or with respect to this Agreement, including without limitation, such reasonable fees and
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT; MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	-6-
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage159"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	expenses of attorneys and accountants, which shall include, without limitation, all fees, costs and expenses of
	appeals. Except as otherwise permitted by the requirements of Section&nbsp;409A of the Code, and the Treasury Regulations issued thereunder (&#147;
<U>
	Section 409A
</U>
	&#148;), any reimbursement to which Participant is entitled pursuant to this
	Section&nbsp;17 shall (a)&nbsp;be paid no later than the last day of Participant&#146;s taxable year following the taxable year in which the expense was incurred, (b)&nbsp;not be affected by the amount of expenses eligible for reimbursement in any
	other taxable year, and (c)&nbsp;not be subject to liquidation or exchange for another benefit.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	17.
<U>
	Notices
</U>
	. Any notices or other
	communications required to be given hereunder shall be given by hand delivery or by first class mail with all fees prepaid and addressed, if to the Company, to it at its principal place of business, Attn: General Counsel, and if to Participant, to
	him, her or it at the address set forth in the signature page hereto.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	18.
<U>
	Severability
</U>
	. If any provision of this Agreement shall
	be held to be illegal, invalid or unenforceable, such illegality, invalidity or unenforceability shall attach only to such provision and shall not in any manner affect or render illegal, invalid or unenforceable any other provision of this
	Agreement, and this Agreement shall be carried out as if any such illegal, invalid or unenforceable provision were not contained herein.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	19.
<U>
	Captions
</U>
	. Captions are for convenience only and are not deemed to be part of this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	20.
<U>
	Counterparts
</U>
	. This Agreement may be executed in two or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of
	which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	21.
<U>
	Compliance with Section&nbsp;409A
</U>
	. The Company intends that
	income provided to Participant pursuant to this Agreement will not be subject to taxation under Section&nbsp;409A. The provisions of this Agreement shall be interpreted and construed in favor of satisfying any applicable requirements of
	Section&nbsp;409A. However, the Company does not guarantee any particular tax effect for income provided to Participant pursuant to this Agreement. In any event, except for the responsibility of the Company to withhold applicable income and
	employment taxes from compensation paid or provided to Participant, the Company shall not be responsible for the payment of any applicable taxes incurred by Participant on compensation paid or provided to Participant pursuant to this Agreement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	[REMAINDER OF PAGE INTENTIONALLY LEFT BLANK]
</B>

	&nbsp;

	-7-

	WITNESS WHEREOF, this Agreement has been executed as an instrument under seal of the date and year first above written.
</P>

<B>
	FORM OF EXECUTIVE OFFICER
</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
<B>
	RESTRICTED STOCK UNITS AGREEMENT
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Marchex, Inc. has granted to the Participant named in the
<I>
	Notice of Grant of Restricted Stock Units
</I>
	(the
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
<B>
<I>
	Grant
	Notice
</I>
</B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
	) to which this Restricted Stock Units Agreement (the
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
<B>
<I>
	Agreement
</I>
</B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
	) is attached an award (the &#147;
<B>
<I>
	Award
</I>
</B>
	&#148;) consisting of Restricted Stock Units (the
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
<B>
<I>
	Units
</I>
</B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
	) subject to the terms and conditions set forth in the Grant Notice and this Agreement. The Award has been granted pursuant to and shall in all respects be subject to the terms and conditions of the
	Marchex, Inc. 2003 Amended and Restated Stock Incentive Plan, as amended to the Grant Date (the
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
<B>
<I>
	Plan
</I>
</B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
	), the provisions of which are incorporated herein by reference. By signing the Grant Notice, the
	Participant: (a)&nbsp;acknowledges receipt of and represents that the Participant has read and is familiar with the Grant Notice, this Agreement, the Plan and a prospectus for the Plan prepared in connection with the registration with the Securities
	and Exchange Commission of the Shares issuable pursuant to the Award (the
<I>
	&#147;
</I>
<B>
<I>
	Plan Prospectus
</I>
</B>
<I>
	&#148;
</I>
	), (b)&nbsp;accepts the Award subject to all of the terms and conditions of the Grant Notice, this Agreement and the
	Plan, and (c)&nbsp;agrees to accept as binding, conclusive and final all decisions or interpretations of the Committee upon any questions arising under the Grant Notice, this Agreement or the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.
<B>
<U>
	D
<SMALL>
	EFINITIONS
</SMALL>
<SMALL>
	AND
</SMALL>
	C
<SMALL>
	ONSTRUCTION
</SMALL>
</U>
<SMALL>
</SMALL>
	.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.1
<B>
	Definitions
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	Unless otherwise defined herein, capitalized terms shall have the meanings assigned in the Grant Notice
	or the Plan.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.2
<B>
	Construction
</B>
<B>
<I>
	.
</I>
</B>
	Captions and titles contained herein are for convenience only and shall not affect
	the meaning or interpretation of any provision of this Agreement. Except when otherwise indicated by the context, the singular shall include the plural and the plural shall include the singular. Use of the term &#147;or&#148; is not intended to be
	exclusive, unless the context clearly requires otherwise.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2.
<B>
<U>
	A
<SMALL>
	DMINISTRATION
</SMALL>
</U>
<SMALL>
</SMALL>
	.
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	All questions of interpretation concerning the Grant Notice, this Agreement and the Plan shall be determined by the Committee. All
	determinations by the Committee shall be final and binding upon all persons having an interest in the Award as provided by the Plan. Any officer shall have the authority to act on behalf of the Company with respect to any matter, right, obligation,
	or election which is the responsibility of or which is allocated to the Company herein, provided the officer has apparent authority with respect to such matter, right, obligation, or election.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.
<B>

<SMALL>
	HE
</SMALL>
	A
<SMALL>
	WARD
</SMALL>
</U>
<SMALL>
</SMALL>

</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.1
<B>
	Grant of Units.
</B>
	On the Grant Date, the Participant shall acquire, subject to the provisions of this Agreement, the Number of
	Restricted Stock Units set forth in the Grant Notice, subject to adjustment as provided in Section&nbsp;9. Each Unit represents a right to receive on a date determined in accordance with the Grant Notice and this Agreement one (1)&nbsp;Share.
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage162"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.2
<B>
	No Monetary Payment Required.
</B>
	The Participant is not required to make any monetary
	payment (other than applicable tax withholding, if any) as a condition to receiving the Units or /s issued upon settlement of the Units, the consideration for which shall be past services actually rendered and/or future services to be rendered to
	the Company or an Affiliate or for its benefit. Notwithstanding the foregoing, if required by applicable state corporate law, the Participant shall furnish consideration in the form of cash or past services rendered having a value not less than the
	par value of the Shares issued upon settlement of the Units.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4.

</SMALL>
	U
<SMALL>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:8%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Units shall vest and become Vested Units as provided in the Grant Notice.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	5.
<B>
<U>
	C
<SMALL>
	OMPANY
</SMALL>
	R
<SMALL>
	EACQUISITION
</SMALL>
	R
<SMALL>
	IGHT
</SMALL>
</U>
<SMALL>
</SMALL>

</B>
